REMARKS.REMARK1: It makes a wonderful addition to any rare trilobite collection
It makes a wonderful addition to any rare enrolled trilobite collection.
It makes a wonderful addition to any trilobite collection.
Rare ITEM of ordovician Asaphidae trilobites from St.Petersburg region
Original ITEM of ordovician Asaphidae trilobites from St.Petersburg region
Huge trilobite!
High preserved. Original surface. Main non-trilobite ITEM of deposits of Asery horizon age.
Unusually beautiful ITEM of ordovician Asaphidae trilobites from St.Petersburg region
It's subITEM with shot eyes
It's direct ancestor of Asaphus kowalewskii!
Two similar ITEM in one stone!!!
It's ITEM with gena spines!
Big trilobite!
Best safety!
Beautiful stone!!
Original preparation!!
Excellent preparation!!
It's subITEM with long eyes
RARE! Intravital injury of left eye!!!
Rare ITEM of ordovician trilobites from St.Petersburg region
Newest described!!!!
Absolutely fine

Original safety of fossils - clustered trilobites shell only one ITEM together. It has not reconstraction of matrix - the position of trilobites is original! The shell of trilobites has little reconstraction nearly 5%.
Original preparation!! Two ITEM in one stone!!
It makes a wonderful addition to any enrolled trilobite collection.
Two ITEM in one stone!!!
It's subITEM with shot eyes!

DESCR.SPECIES:
-
Described by: Lawrow, 1856, p. 239, pl. 5 , fig.a-c.
-
Described by: Lesnikova, 1949, p.283, pl.70, fig. 2a and 2b.
-
Described by: Schmidt, 1901, p.61, pl. 5 , fig.10a and 10b.
-
Described as Asaphus latus var. plautini by Schmidt, 1901, p.64, pl. 6 , figs.1 and 2 // Revision as Asaphus plautini plautini by Ivantsov, 2003, p.S313, pl.14, figs. 5-7
-
Described by Wahlenberg, 1821; // Final revision by Ivantsov, 2002, p. S271, pl.2, figs.1-5
-
Described by Dalman, 1828 as Asaphus expansus var. ranicepcs // Late described by Angelin, 1854 as Asaphus ranicepcs // Final revision by Ivantsov, 2002, p. S279, pl.4, figs.1-4
-
Described by Lesnikova and Weber, 1949, pl.69, fig.4 as Asaphus platiurus // Revision by Ivantsov, 2000, p.52, pl.9, figs.2 and 3 as Subasaphus spinifer.
-
Described by: Pander, 1830, p.137; Schmidt, 1901, pl. 4 , fig. 4 .
-
Described by Balashova, 1953, p.409, pl.4, figs.12-15 // Revision by Ivantsov, 2002, pl.12, figs.1-3
-
Described as Asaphus latisegmentatus by Nieszkowskii, 1857, p.39, pl. 2 , fig.1 // Revision as Asaphus platyurus latisegmentatus by Jaanusson, 1953b, p.475, pl.2, figs. 4-6 // Revision as Subasaphus latisegmentatus by Ivantsov, 2003, p.S323, pl. 18, figs. 3-8.
-
Described by: Ivantsov, 2003, p.S299, pl. 10 , figs.3-7.
-
Described by WAHLENBERG, 1821, vol. VIII p.52; fig. see Friedrich Quenstedt, 1852, tab. 55.
-
Described as Asaphus eichwaldi by Schmidt, 1901, p.41, pl.4, figs. 6,9 and 10. // Described as Asaphus sulevi by Jaanusson, 1953, p.393 // Revision by Ivantsov, 2002, pl.7, figs.1-4
-
Described by: Ivantsov, 2003, p.S299, pl. 10 , figs.3-7.
-
Described by Eichwald, 1840, p.70 as Amphion fisheri // Revision by F.Schmidt, 1881, p.191, pl.XII, figs.1-8 as Pliomera fisheri
-
Described as Asaphus delphinus by Lawrow, 1856, p.238, pl.4, figs. a-c. Revision as Delphasaphus delphinus by Ivantsov, 2003, p.S332, pl. 19, figs. 1-4
-
Described as Asaphus cornutus var. holmi by Schmidt, 1901, pp. 50-52, pl.4, figs. 8a and 8b. // Revision as Asaphus holmi by Ivantsov, 2003, p.S310, pl.15, figs. 4 and 5.
-
Described by: Eichwald, Fr.Schmidt XXX №1, 1881, pl.XII , fig.14-17.
-
Described by: Schmidt, 1901, p.61, pl. 5 , fig.10a and 10b.
-
Described by Jaanusson, 1953a, p.393 // Revision by Ivantsov, 2002, pl.8, figs.1-4
-
Described by F.Schmidt, 1901, p.58, pl.5, figs.1-6 // Revision by Ivantsov, 2002, pl.8, figs.5-6
-
Described by: Balashova, 1953, p.407, pl. 4 , fig.8-11.
-
Described by Pander, 1830, p.136 // Revision by Ivantsov, 2003, p.S313, pl.16, figs. 4-9.
-
Described by Boeck, 1838, p.102; Stormer, 1940, p. 141, pl. 3, figs. 12-15 // Recision by Ivantsov, 2002, p. s283, pl. 5, figs. 1-3
-
Undescribed ITEM of genus Subasaphus (?). For the first time was identified at 2006 year. Earlier this ITEM was indentified as variation of Asaphus cornutus. It's occurence together with Asaphus intermedius and Asaphus kowalewskii

Described by F.Schmidt, 1906, p.40, figs.11, ; Revision by Balashova, 1976
-
Described by: Nieszkowskii, 1858, p.364, pl.1, fig.7-10. Revision by Schmidt, 1885, p.82, pl.3, fig. 13-25
-

Not described at last time. Undescribed ITEM of genus Subasaphus (?). For the first time was identified at 2006 year. Earlier this ITEM was indentified as variation of Asaphus cornutus. It's occurence together with Asaphus intermedius and Asaphus kowalewskii

Described by: Schmidt, 1898, p.20; 1901, p.37, pl. 2 , figs.8-10. Also described by Lamanskii, Lesnikova and Weber, Balashova. Newest described by Ivantsov, 2003, p. S284, pl.5, figs. 4-6

Described by Eichwald, 1840, p.70 as Amphion fisheri; Revision by F.Schmidt, 1881, p.191, pl.XII, figs.1-8
-
Described by: Ivantsov, 2003, p.S313, pl. 14 , figs.1-4.
-
Undescribed ITEM of genus Subasaphus (?). For the first time was identified at 2006 year. Earlier this ITEM was indentified as variation of Asaphus cornutus. It's occurence together with Asaphus intermedius and Asaphus kowalewskii
-
Described by Schmidt, 1898, p.20; also 1901, p.21, plate 2, figs. 4-7; next described Balashova, 1953, p. 388, pl.1, fig. 1, pl. 2, figs. 1 and 2; next described Jaanusson, 1953a; last-described Ivantsov, 2003, p. S318, pl. 16, figs. 1-3.
-
Described by: Eichwald, 1840, p.79. Latest revision by Ivantsov, 2003, p.329, pl. 20, figs. 5-7.
-
Undescribed ITEM of genus Subasaphus (?). For the first time was identified at 2006 year. Earlier this ITEM was indentified as variation of Asaphus cornutus. It's occurence together with Asaphus intermedius and Asaphus kowalewskii
-
Undescribed ITEM of genus Subasaphus (?). For the first time was identified at 2006 year. Earlier this ITEM was indentified as variation of Asaphus cornutus. It's occurence together with Asaphus intermedius and Asaphus kowalewskii
-
Described by Schmidt and Jaanusson as Asaphus eichwaldi var.knyrkoi, described by Balashova and Ivantsov (latest revision) as Asaphus knyrkoi
-
First described by Niezkowskii, 1859 as Asaphus lepidurus, latest described by Ivantsov, 2003.

Described by Balashova 1976.

Described by Balashova, 1974. Coming from BIIb level. Occurrence together with Asaphus broeggeri.
